cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 85 miles ESE of Caibarién, Cuba and 275 miles SSE of Miami, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn northwest today, pass near the Florida Keys Sunday morning, then move north-northwest up the Florida west coast toward the Tampa Bay region late Sunday before continuing inland toward Georgia/Alabama
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the southwest coast of Florida (around the Marco Island–Naples area)

weather_observation.under_warning: Hurricane Warning and Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Anclote River to Indian Pass (hurricane watch), North of Anclote River to Suwannee River (storm-surge watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Volusia/Brevard County Line southward around the Florida peninsula to Anclote River, including Tampa Bay and the Florida Keys
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida west coast from Cape Sable through Tampa Bay, plus the Florida Keys and adjacent Gulf waters
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (50–70%) of sustained tropical-storm to hurricane-force winds (50–70 kt) Sunday afternoon through early Monday, with gusts potentially exceeding 80 kt if the core tracks just east of the bay.
weather_observation.storm_surge: NHC forecast 3–5 ft inundation above ground level in Tampa Bay if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–15 inches of rain with isolated totals to 20 inches could cause flash flooding in the Tampa Bay region.
weather_observation.other_hazards: A few tornadoes possible; dangerous rip currents and very rough seas will halt port operations.
